wikipedia_page.main: Mary Ann Radcliffe (1746 – 1818) was an important British figure in the early feminist movement.

response: * Mary Ann Radcliffe (1746–1818), British figure in the early feminist movement

Hester Chapone adopted Fidelia as her protagonist's pseudonym in "The Story of Fidelia" (1753–1754), in Nos 77–79 of the English newspaper The Adventurer.DNB text. Retrieved 13 April 2019.Text of the story. Retrieved 13 April 2019. Mary Ann Radcliffe did likewise in a short piece of sentimental fiction.Published in The Female Advocate: or an Attempt to Recover the Rights of Women from Male Usurpation (1799). See Catherine Packham: Eighteenth-Century Vitalism: Bodies, Culture, Politics (Basingstoke, UK: Palgrave Macmillan, 2012).
